attributes.action: disallow the removal of Bansky's art.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
'Stencilled artwork from the guerrilla artist can be seen on walls across London.' Bansky's art livens up the otherwise monotonous urban landscape by adding colour and originality to dull buildings and areas.

Most graffiti is just a scribble of a name however Bansky's charming art shows talent. It brings a smile to our faces, it is neither pornographic nor obscene and in many cases it is beautiful. 

A Tower Hamlets councillor said of Bansky's art:
"It spoils the environment, makes our neighbourhoods feel less safe, and costs thousands of pounds each year to clean - money that could instead be paying for valuable local services." 

We do not want this art to be cleaned, therefore the council do not need to pay for its removal.

It's a serious world out there, why not have one thing that makes us smile?

reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
